ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: The people who have taqwa will be in a safe place
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Surely those who fear and follow the straight path will be in a place of peace and security
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Verily the God-fearing shall be in a secure place
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The pious ones will be in a secure place
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Indeed the pious are in a place of peace.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, those who have Taqwa, will be in place of security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely those who guard (against evil) are in a secure place,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Surely the godfearing shall be in a station secure
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! those who kept their duty will be in a place secured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But those mindful of God will be in a safe place,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily the God-fearing will be in a place secure
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed the Godwary will be in a safe place,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As to the Righteous (they will be) in a position of Security,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily! The Muttaqun (pious - see V. 2:2), will be in place of Security (Paradise).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Indeed, for those who feared (Allah) is a secure place
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As for the righteous, they will be in a secure place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, the righteous will be in a secure place;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:51] Assuredly the God-fearing will be in a secure place, a seat in which there will be security from [all] fear,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! those who kept their duty) those who ward off disbelief, idolatry and indecencies, i.e. Abu Bakr and his believing brothers, (will be in a place secure) a place safe from death, ruin or torment
